course_title: Variable Topics in Women, Gender & Sexuality Studies: Harvey Milk's Life&Afterlives
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 4 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement: - Region, Theme.
Harvey Bernard Milk, a Jewish gay community activist, elected to the San Francisco Board of Supervisors on November 8, 1977, was assassinated in his office at San Francisco City Hall on the morning of November 27, 1978. This seminar course will explore who Harvey Milk was during his life (a "New York Jew," a gay community activist, and a politician) and who he became after his death (a martyr and iconic figure). Through our focus on Milk's life and cultural "afterlives," we will investigate the intersectional nature of identity, the construction and interpretation of "hero" and martyr figures, the nature of collective memory, the ways in which religious language and imagery are used to honor "secular saints," and how conflicting claims are made for cultural icons.


(Same as REL 270 3 & JS 273 3)
